name: The Fate of Empyrenea
description:
An elegiac and a narrative-heavy tale where under your fingertips lie multiple pathways that converge into an ultimatum, that is, the destination of the eponymous continent. 

The tale is told from different perspectives of characters, each sharing a piece of the puzzle that is Ophiuchus. Who is he exactly? From whence did he come from and what are the secrets he is keeping from you, his beloved child? 

Word Count: 23k

Genre: Angst,  Realistic Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Hurt/Comfort & Tragedy  

Rating: 18+

Summary:

Nations envisage you as a notorious henchman serving a tyrant.

You. The Serpent: executor of wills at the behest of the sovereign of Empyrenea, the man named after the thirteenth Zodiac, your Father. With sharp fangs and finesse, you suppress rebellions sizzling in the nation-states, sprouting like untamed weeds

Year 221, New Age. An epoch that has crawled out the Age of Magic, tests you— you have suffered a lot, and the worst part is, you can’t remember anything in the past. Just fragments. And getting caught by an elite force tasked with capturing you doesn’t alleviate your situation in the slightest. They force you into assimilation within the territories who see you as a potential ally. Truly, you must become the snake hidden in the grass.

Your journey into the inferior realms has you unraveling the threads of information people have about your Father, Ophiuchus, as frayed and scant the material is.

You think you know him the best. But the truth is: you have the least information on him of all.

Features:

  • Gender-selectable MC
  • Immersive atmosphere
  • Revolving POVs from the main cast
  • Indulge in some child-parent bonding with Ophiuchus, or don’t 
  • Choose the color of your scales!
